message.body: Yo dude. Do you know any good loan consultation companies?
For what kind of loans?
Well I have federal (subsidized and unsubsidized stafford) and private (educational and personal). My knowledge of how this all works is limited...
Oh, you are going to love this. So, your president, Barak Obama, nationalized the student loan industry in order to pay for that national health care thi
ngy. So as a result, the borrowing cost for education is hundreds of billions of dollars more expensive than what the private market could provide. For e
xample, the student loan nationalization is going to cost me $40,000. But hey, it's all in the name of progress, right? So even though you're carrying a
larger loan burden, you can take solace in the fact your helping people get free, and unlimited, access to health care.
I do love that. But. That's not a consolidation company...
No, you can't consolidate student loans anymore because of the student loan nationalization. You can still role up all of your loans into one loan based
on the weighted average of your loans. But you don't want to do that because it takes away the ability to pay off the highest interest rate loans first.
But ive seen some companies that offer consolidating?
Private banks will do it. But they will treat it as a non-collateralized loan with recourse; meaning that the interest rate will be higher than what's al
ready on the loans. More than likely, it will be a floating rate which may look attractive in a zero interest rate environment, but the minute rates star
t going up yo will lose your shorts.
So no consolidating for me.
No, I would say not. I've been watching this space for a while and it doesn't look good. If you need further explanation you can call me tonight or stop
by my office.
Ok cool. Once I have real questions I'll do that sometime soon. Where's your office?
Top floor of the Wells Fargo building. It's one of the best views in town.
So if I get Ito an elevator and go to the top floor I'll find you?
Yep. 51st floor.
Will you be at lunch at 1? Or can I stop by?
I'm not going to be able to leave for lunch today. But you can stop by if you'd like.
Do you have some time or would another time be better? Or would it be better if I call tonight?
What time do you leave work? If you want to stop by after work that would be fine. I'll probably be here late.
Like 4? Is that ok?
Yes, that would be fine.
